archimate:ApplicationComponent.name: Data Normalization
archimate:ApplicationComponent.documentation:
Data Normalization – This is the process of - extracting the data from the encapsulated device message, for example parsing from JSON or CSV files - and placing it into a data storage schema, for example • time series databases with standardized key tags for sensor types / readings for structured data with log files, • images and video being kept used for unstructured data • Geospatial data can be kept in a geodatabase.
Data homogenization is the process bringing all data into a common geospatial framework to ensure consistency of data, integrity of analysis and validity of results. source: User, Super. "6.3 Data Homogenization". Cdema.Org, 2022, https://www.cdema.org/virtuallibrary/index.php/charim-hbook/data-management-book/6-managing-geospatial-data/6-3-data-homogenization. Accessed 24 Apr 2022.
